results.title: A Short story about love
results.creator_credit: Karen Wootton and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Karen is young, travelling and in love. When she returns from her travels she discovers she has HIV and with this diagnosis her life changes. Karen must come to terms with life’s new circumstances as she laments the fact that she may never have another relationship or be a mother. But life does move on for Karen and with the help of friends and family, Karen finds love again.
results.description: Karen is young, travelling and in love. When she returns from her travels she discovers she has HIV and with this diagnosis her life changes. Karen must come to terms with life’s new circumstances as she laments the fact that she may never have another relationship or be a mother. But life does move on for Karen and with the help of friends and family, Karen finds love again.
description_for_label: Karen is young, travelling and in love. When she returns from her travels she discovers she has HIV and with this diagnosis her life changes. Karen must come to terms with life’s new circumstances as she laments the fact that she may never have another relationship or be a mother. But life does move on for Karen and with the help of friends and family, Karen finds love again.

results.title: No more funerals
results.creator_credit: Michelle W and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Michelle is diagnosed with HIV in the early 80’s. She reflects on how treatments have improved over the years and celebrates the fact that she no longer attends as many funerals.
results.description: Michelle is diagnosed with HIV in the early 80’s. She reflects on how treatments have improved over the years and celebrates the fact that she no longer attends as many funerals.

results.title: Healing
results.creator_credit: Judith Odgers and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Judith is teaching in Thailand as a young teacher. It is an extraordinary cultural experience and also life changing as Judith is diagnosed with HIV. This story delves into the psyche of a young woman coming to terms with the taboos and limitations of the virus she has contracted.
results.description: Judith is teaching in Thailand as a young teacher. It is an extraordinary cultural experience and also life changing as Judith is diagnosed with HIV. This story delves into the psyche of a young woman coming to terms with the taboos and limitations of the virus she has contracted.

results.title: Director's cut
results.creator_credit: Stephanie Moore and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Stephanie reflects on her time as director of Positive Women, a support and advocacy organisation for women with HIV. She is inspired by the courage of the women who must come to terms with a disease that can kill them or significantly reduce their quality of life.
results.description: Stephanie reflects on her time as director of Positive Women, a support and advocacy organisation for women with HIV. She is inspired by the courage of the women who must come to terms with a disease that can kill them or significantly reduce their quality of life.
description_for_label: Stephanie reflects on her time as director of Positive Women, a support and advocacy organisation for women with HIV. She is inspired by the courage of the women who must come to terms with a disease that can kill them or significantly reduce their quality of life.

results.title: Being positive
results.creator_credit: Heather Ellis and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A sensitive and warmly told story by Heather Ellis, mother and wife, diagnosed HIV positive in 1997 upon returning to Australia from a trip to Africa. Heather’s greatest fear is the stigma which may be attached to her son Ethan who is HIV negative but yet she feels privileged that medication is available in Australia for recovery and prevention of positive babies being born. In Africa they do not have this privilege.
results.description: A sensitive and warmly told story by Heather Ellis, mother and wife, diagnosed HIV positive in 1997 upon returning to Australia from a trip to Africa. Heather’s greatest fear is the stigma which may be attached to her son Ethan who is HIV negative but yet she feels privileged that medication is available in Australia for recovery and prevention of positive babies being born. In Africa they do not have this privilege.
description_for_label: A sensitive and warmly told story by Heather Ellis, mother and wife, diagnosed HIV positive in 1997 upon returning to Australia from a trip to Africa. Heather’s greatest fear is the stigma which may be attached to her son Ethan who is HIV negative but yet she feels privileged that medication is available in Australia for recovery and prevention of positive babies being born. In Africa they do not have this privilege.

results.title: We shall remember them
results.creator_credit: ACMI, ACMI Digital Storytelling and John Thompson
results.brief_description: John Thompson remembers the generations of soldiers that have passed through the Australian Light Horse Memorial Park in Seymour. While honouring their memory, he also welcomes the restoration of the park to create a place of beauty for all future Australians.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI, ACMI Digital Storytelling and John Thompson

results.title: Vocational indecision
results.creator_credit: ACMI, ACMI Digital Storytelling and Leanne Beattie
results.brief_description: Leanne Beattie takes us down the long path to finding her ideal career. It is not always something that comes to you during your school years, and maybe not for a long time after that, but sometimes, when you just focus on what you enjoy, eventually you find it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI, ACMI Digital Storytelling and Leanne Beattie
